official-title.#text:

header.#text: Continuous Glucose Monitoring Device; CGM qualified individual

that continuously

text.#text: The term
Such term applies to such medical device—
as a stand-alone product;
when integrated with an insulin pump; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , such as artificial pancreas device systems.

shall treat an insulin pump or other

text.#text:
With respect to a continuous glucose monitoring device that is described in clause (ii) or (iii) of
			 subparagraph (B), the

Such term includes components, accessories, and supplies that are necessary and related to the
			 operation of the class III medical device, such as sensors, transmitters,
			 receivers, and requisite software.
The term
An individual with Type I diabetes—

who is following an intensive insulin treatment regimen that consists of 3 or more insulin
			 injections per day or the use of a subcutaneous insulin infusion pump;

subject to paragraph (3), whose attending physician certifies that the individual’s condition
			 cannot be safely and effectively managed with self-monitoring of blood
			 glucose; and
who—

has been unable to achieve optimum glycemic control in accordance with evidence-based guidelines;
			 or
has experienced hypoglycemia unawareness or frequent hypoglycemic episodes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may specify for the furnishing of a continuous glucose
			 monitoring device based on available medical evidence and taking into
			 account any anticipated pathway to the development of artificial pancreas
			 device systems.

text.#text: An individual not described in subparagraph (A) who meets such other medical criteria as the

An individual with diabetes who has been regularly using a continuous glucose monitoring device
			 before becoming entitled to, or enrolling in, part A, or enrolling in part
			 B, or both.

For purposes of a certification by an attending physician described in paragraph (2)(A)(ii), such
			 certification shall not be required more frequently than once every 3
			 years.

header.#text: Accounting for differences in functionalities among various CGM devices

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide for
			 annual updates to the payment rate under the fee schedule established
			 under this subsection for each such device for the preceding year by the
			 percentage increase in the consumer price index for all urban consumers
			 (United States city average) for the 12-month period ending with June of
			 the preceding year.

text.#text:
With respect to each year beginning after the year, or partial year, referred to in paragraph

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide for adjustments to the payment rates under the fee schedule established
			 under this subsection to take into account geographic variations in the
			 prices of continuous glucose monitoring devices.

The amendments made by this section shall apply to items and services furnished on or after January
			 1, 2015.
